website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive hair curler product from a well-known brand.
pros: Works well on both wet and dry hair
Foam construction is comfortable for sleeping
cons: Rollers may not easily snap shut if hair is particularly thick or long

customer_reviews.title: I do a little surgery on these and they're great.
customer_reviews.text: I take the plastic frames out and slide strips of a cut up t-shirt through the holes instead. Then I just use them like rag rollers. They work great that way. Otherwise, the plastic always breaks my hair.
customer_reviews.author: Lila

customer_reviews.title: Not made with disabled people in mind
customer_reviews.text: So the rollers work really well and I’m very pleased with the end result. The problem is the smaller rollers are not made with disabled people in mind. I have Ehlers Danlos Syndrome and while trying to snap/unsnap the smaller rollers I dislocated my thumb and finger several times. It’s 2019 and products should be made to work for everyone, not just able bodied people. So yes, the end result was beautiful, but they need to change how the rollers close.
customer_reviews.author: Sandi DiMarco

customer_reviews.title: Used Rollers
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely disgusting. I received used rollers with hair and stains included.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Small Rollers- pack a punch!
customer_reviews.text: Rollers are A LOT smaller than I thought (reason for one star deduction), but I found a method that works really well (see picture). Have Dry hair, put hair in mid-high pony tail, spray inch piece of hair with “Not Your Mother’s” sea salt spray, curl in the pink and green rollers, sleep in over night, take hair down. Super easy and comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: SARA

customer_reviews.title: Stained and Smelly
customer_reviews.text: The first order I received was awful... they were stained and also smelled gross. The smelled like they were in a hoarder's garage for years and the stains were from possible sun damage. I have a family member who was a hoarder... so trust me, I know. After complaining, I was shipped another package and the SAME exact stains all over the rollers and they smelled. I threw both packages away as I refuse to put these in my hair. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lala_b

customer_reviews.title: Good value product
customer_reviews.text: I just grabbed these as an attempt to loosen my curls for a special event. I think I till need a bit of practice to get the roots right but they worked pretty well. You’ve got to make sure you keep all your hair on the top of the foam otherwise it will get caught and it won’t feel good 👎🏽 Worked well for what I want, now I just need some practice ☺️ The first 3 photos are after I’ve put my hair up and down like 5 times and the last two photos are what my natural hair looks like
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra

customer_reviews.title: Big & Soft!
customer_reviews.text: Naturally curly hair has to be dry when rolled or TOO curly! These are perfect: big rollers = looser curls, softness = good night’s sleep (with cap)! Bought 2 sets for me, 2 for my curly-haired sister! AND you can replace the wires when they get too kinked up - I used a “soft”, fat craft wire.
customer_reviews.author: Longwing1

customer_reviews.title: But two packages if you have thick or a lot of hair.
customer_reviews.text: They’re foam rollers and they get the job done if you’re into vintage styles. However, if you have a lot of hair like I do, than I recommend two packages. I didn’t have nearly enough of the largest size due to all my extra hair. Drying power is meh, and I’ve tried different levels of “dampness.” But if you have time and patience and a good setting lotion, you’ll be okay.
customer_reviews.author: Kirstie M. Pham

customer_reviews.title: Larger Size is Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I have a vintage look going on and prefer to do overnight wet sets on my curly hair for a better hold and less heat damage. I hate that ALL the soft/foam rollers and small in size for a tight curl or are hard rollers that are too hard to sleep on. These are the perfect size for a larger curl and are easy to roll and sleep on. So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Raquel

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I normally bring heavy heat rollers for my hair when I travel and I wanted to lighten my suitcase. These do the trick, so much so that now I use them at home too instead of the heat rollers. And I love that there are many different sizes since my hair goes from shorter to medium length to shorter all of the time, so I need many of the sizes. They seem pretty strong and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Sandrina Roc

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line - New Best curlers should have rec'd 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Oh oh, I made a mistake. These are the sponge rollers which hold the moisture which I gave a review on 'The New Best flexible foam and sponge curlers'. Now I will back tract - I love the New Best flexible foam and sponge curlers. This is what I do: I shampoo my hair once a week, and use the Conair Rollers. Then each day I use the New Best curlers in areas where I want a little more curl - just putting a small amount of moisture on the hair - within 45 min. to an hour, my hair is dry - I am 'ready to go'!
customer_reviews.author: Ron S.

customer_reviews.title: WORK GREAT! USE ALLIGATOR CLIPS TO HOLD THEM.
customer_reviews.text: I use these almost every night. I pull my longish hair to the top and use about 4 curlers. Other reviewers have complained about the plastic things that are supposed to hold the rollers in. I just toss those and use the 3-1/2" alligator clips to hold them. No problem!
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely horrible. Very small
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible. Very small, cheap plastic clips break. And dont expect nice, soft curls as shown on the package. You get tight clumps of frizz with no shape whatsoever. I gave them to my 15 year old grand daughter and after using them once, she threw them in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Outstander

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Looks like we received someones returned item along with their hair. Will be throwing these away.
customer_reviews.author: The Church at Oak Level

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Tried to roll my hair with these. Couldn't get the first one in to stay tight. Finally broke the plastic. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Missy C

customer_reviews.title: Great to sleep in!
customer_reviews.text: After using and sleeping in the skinner, more expensive version of these I bought these on a whim at the store. They are a game changer and I bought another pack of them on Amazon. They are easy to wrap even shorter hair, but I wouldn’t recommend them for someone who has short hair top and bottom. These rollers are a dream to sleep in and really do create wavy curls on dry hair in 30/45 mins- this does take more planning, but I try to use these instead of an iron or blow dryer - no heat damage! I put them in almost every day while watching a tv show or walking around the house if I have time.
customer_reviews.author: J.June

customer_reviews.title: The plastic hook leaves a crimp on the hair
customer_reviews.text: These would be good if not for the plastic clamp that goes around the hair. This clamp leaves a mark on my hair, so I really can't use these rollers. I use others that roll up but require no clamp. I use my prong roller clips instead. Maybe these work for some people though, you will just have to try for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: SocalDancer

customer_reviews.title: My hair is short so sometimes the rollers do not ...
customer_reviews.text: My hair is short so sometimes the rollers do not stay on. my biggest complaint is that the locking mechanism is not 360 degrees. if you end up the roll at your hairline and the latch is not matching the catch it is hard on your fingers to close the latch and you sometimes have to reroll.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Clamps are trick to close and open, easily tangles and pulls hair
customer_reviews.text: Purpose : I used these foam rollers to style a wig. Pros: Next day shipping and delivery which was nice. No damages or issues. Easy to use and makes beautiful curls! Cons: The clamps with the rollers are tricky to close and open. Clamps easily get tangled in the hair. For this reason, I had to spend a good amount of time untangling pieces of hair in order to get a few of the foam rollers out. Also be careful when taking out the rollers because the clamps tend to pull out strands of hair if you aren't careful. Overall, I am satisfied with this purchase. It worked for what I needed to get done.
customer_reviews.author: SoaringEagle

customer_reviews.title: Love them trick for long thick hair 80%dry
customer_reviews.text: I personally love these. I usually use large hot rollers in my hair. I have for years because curling iron curls don't stay for me. I also try to avoid using products in my hair. The trick to using them on long hair (past mid back is gettting your hair about 80% dry.) I use these when I travel for work and it makes my life so easy. I have long, thick, Latina/Native Amerian hair. Basically my hair is straight but easy to scrunch for curls and very dark brown.
customer_reviews.author: JennH

customer_reviews.title: These rollers are great!
customer_reviews.text: I have extremely unmanageable hair, these Jumbo rollers smooth my hair into soft beautiful curls. They're easy to put on and remove unlike the expensive sponge rollers with Velcro closures. Velcro sticks to my hair and pulls it out. I purchased the inexpensive clamps to use with these rollers and I am very happy. I plan on buying another set.
customer_reviews.author: I wanted a mask with no pleats

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Favorite curlers. Put them loosely in my hair after a shower before bed and when I wake up I have the best beachy waves. The tighter i put them in, the tighter of a curl I get. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lunch Lady

customer_reviews.title: By far the worst product I've ever purchased on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: By far the worst product I've ever purchased on Amazon. I actually had to cut several of these out of my hair. The ones that did come out left my hair a frizzy mess. I've used foam rollers before and have never had an experience like this. If you do purchase just know that you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amber M.

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Decent rollers but a little too large for me. I need something to create a loose spiral curl on the sides of my hair due to inconsistent curl pattern but these didn’t do it for me. Would work better if they could fasten without folding the roller.
customer_reviews.author: LSTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: I have very fine thin hair so the net is necessary
customer_reviews.text: These were a little too large for my hair but my hair is still growing out. I usually use the size smaller and sleep in them over night. I have to wear a hair net to keep them in place. I have very fine thin hair so the net is necessary. Very comfortable sleeping and you get the desired results without further heat damage to your hair.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Moberly

customer_reviews.title: Nice curls, but hair got stuck
customer_reviews.text: These foam rollers were nicely packed in a reusable container. They were easy enough to put in my hair and gave me some decent curls. The problem is that taking them out of my hair was a challenge. Some bits of my hair would get stuck. I wanted to use these to avoid heat on my hair, but Because my hair was stuck, some of my strands broke. I had to remove the plastic from the inside of the roller and pull my hair off of the foam in order for my strands not to break. Even though the result was good, the hassle to get the rollers off was not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: Casy

customer_reviews.title: Really like it!
customer_reviews.text: I only use the largest size, the blue ones. I tried out different ways to leave them in overnight. The best way which gave me the best curls and was able to sleep comfortably at home is putting my hair in a high pony tail, and then splitting my pony tail in 5 and using the blue curlers. In the morning, my hair had volume from being pinned up so high and the tips were curled beautifully! Definitely recommend this product and for the price it is!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Old school classic
customer_reviews.text: These are a classic. Just as easy to use as I remember, roll, snap and done. I use these overnight with dry hair and wake up to amazing volume. I recommend using them with a head cover to keep them from coming loose when sleeping. (A ‘turbie twist’ has worked best.) Comfy enough for sleeping, and at a nice price!
customer_reviews.author: Melaina Lara

customer_reviews.title: As shown. Ok for wet set.
customer_reviews.text: Did a wet set with them and they dried easily overnight. Bent to proper shape. Must be used with "over and under" curling of your hair or it will not sit on your head correctly and will need pins/clips. Average comfort for sleep. Need to wear a silk scarf to make sure no friction. Can feel wire when laying down. Needed two packages for my hair which is long. Still curled the bottom half of my hair well. Colors as shown. Not sure how to clean them though.
customer_reviews.author: SCNGrimace

customer_reviews.title: Nope.  These just don't work.
customer_reviews.text: I tried this in my long hair, hoping for smooth, loose waves. Unfortunately, most of the rollers kept falling out and the ones that didn't produced far smaller curls than I expected. I usually love Conair, but this product is not worth it. Too bad I tucked the package away and forgot to return them!
customer_reviews.author: Sandra J.

customer_reviews.title: Gross
customer_reviews.text: Gross, curlers had someone's hair wrapped around some of them. I did not notice till I was going to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: I learned a lot by reading other people's reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Now I know the tricks are: to have your hair wet or damp to roll. Remove clips while rolling. Put them back in, as each roll is done. After your hair is dry - reverse the process. Remove the clips, unroll the roller and no more ouches!
customer_reviews.author: MaryMartha

customer_reviews.title: Love these rollers!
customer_reviews.text: These rollers are great for giving your hair full body and bounce with little curl. I have string-straight, baby-fine hair, although there is a lot of it. I would suggest using duckbill clips to make sure the hold is secure and make sure you tie your hair up in a scarf or nightcap to prevent grabbing by the pillowcase, but they are comfortable to sleep in, and my hair looks great in the morning. I just needed something to give my hair some body and bounce, without a lot of curl, and these rollers worked beautifully! I'm actually going to order another set so I can do my whole head!
customer_reviews.author: Christina Blank

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable to sleep with them on.
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps I need more practice using these foam hair rollers, but they are not as good as I was expecting and also they are not comfortable to sleep with them on. I tried, but kept waking up as they poked my head and my hair kept being pulled every time I moved. I don't hate them, but I'm glad I didn't buy two sets as I won't be using them much...I'll probably end up giving them away.
customer_reviews.author: ACHA

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: I have 3c hair and usually struggle with air dry rollers being comfortable, staying in, or breaking my hair with velcro attachment. These are amazing. I'm having trouble finding a second set!
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: These worked great and am very happy with the product. Tip: Yes these style of curler leave impressions on the hair from the clip. I place a strip of folded muslin material on the side that the clip will be in contact with the hair. Cut the pieces long enough on the width and length so that they overlap a little bit, the clip will close if the material overlaps. No more lines imprinted to ruin your curls.
customer_reviews.author: Redd

customer_reviews.title: The best to sleep in!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I'm talking to my A-A ladies! These are so much more comfy to sleep in than flexi-rods; you barely feel these. I used it with Nairobi setting lotion and it lasts for days if you use the pineapple method at night with a satin bonnet! Check the photos!
customer_reviews.author: Vett Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Great for Heat Resistant Wigs
customer_reviews.text: I can't rate comfort or drying power since these are for wig use only and not for my own hair. I will be ordering another pack since one doesn't give you quite enough to curl a thick Arda wig. So if you are doing a wig, order two packs. They work well much better than the hard plastic rollers and hold up to the boiling water needed to curl wigs.
customer_reviews.author: Freya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Wet Sets
customer_reviews.text: I love these rollers! I use them almost 2-3 times a week for wet setting my hair overnight. They hold great and I do not find them too uncomfortable to sleep in. They leave great curl in my hair when i remove them once the hair is fully dry. I have had these for months now, maybe even a year. When they start to look too distorted I just hand wash them with some warm water and dish soap and let them dry. They bounce right back. These work so much better than pillow rollers for my hair!
customer_reviews.author: Shop Girl

customer_reviews.title: The zipper on the carrying case will not open (cases are useless!)
customer_reviews.text: I totally agree with the woman who uploaded her video about not being able to open the carrying case. I ordered two (2) sets of these rollers. NEITHER of the two plastic carrying cases would open. The zipper just wouldn't open. The cases are totally useless and I've been told they are not returnable. So I will have to cut through the carrying cases and sew up a holder of some sort. What a bother!
customer_reviews.author: Marvy

customer_reviews.title: Updated sponge rollers
customer_reviews.text: I used these rollers for a quick refresh or an overnight set. As i recall, my hair varied based on how tight i rolled it but the tight curls seemed to loosen up so just run your fingers through your hair if ghe curls are too tight until its the way you want it. If you're not flat ironing your hair you can spritz it with water or a little leave-in conditioner while using your fungers to loosen the curls.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: So you think that these rollers come in a cute travel case, and they do. The problem is that some mental defective at conair decided to put a tiny piece of plastic through the zipper tab. Had to cut the bag to get the rollers out. Ridiculous!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Soft curls
customer_reviews.text: I like the curl you get from the curlers. They are easy to use. Kind of flimsy. One already cracked. One negative thing about these curlers is that they leave an indent in your hair where the plastic closes. Takes time to then use curling iron to get the indent out of your hair. I would not purchase these again. lots of little curlers and not enough larger ones.
customer_reviews.author: litlgran

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: I know sponge rollers do not work well for everyone, but I have always used Conair sponge rollers and they have always done a fantastic job on my hair. I have thick but straight hair that falls flat but usually responds well to heat or styling tools such as these. My hair is short now, as in barely long enough to tuck behind my ears, but these still grip my hair and give great volume and a retro style. Bonus points for the varying sizes!!!
customer_reviews.author: AllyMW

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to these but for my hair type and lifestyle they just didn't work. Even though they are foam I still had a hard time sleeping with them in. I have fine, thin caucasian hair and they were hard to get to stay in my hair without sliding down and unraveling. I tried several different methods, including taking out the plastic clips and securing them with string as one of the other reviews suggested, but they just didnt work for me. Luckily they were pretty cheap so I don't feel like I lost too much money in trying them.
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Conair Soft, Bouncy Curls Foam Rollers, 48 Pack
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a friend of mine and she said she likes them. From the pictures, I thought they were just foam rods that you wrapped your hair around, didn't realize they were actually curlers. She likes them though because she has short hair. Not sure how they would work on my super long hair. Nice packaging and pretty colors though.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dougher

customer_reviews.title: Weird fit
customer_reviews.text: After trying this, I rather use velcro rollers than foam. They dont give much volume. Maybe when used on wet hair? but unfortunately, they are didnt work well on my hair. They are soft and well made though and didnt pinch my head.
customer_reviews.author: ExoticSunflower

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Any of My Others
customer_reviews.text: This product is just like any other foam roller EXCEP... it actually stays closed!!!!! The hinge on most foam rollers is not made to actually hold. This one is. The curler isn't going to fall apart when you try to roll your hair nor does it come out later while you are wearing it. The size ended up being too large for me (totally my fault for not reading the description well). But the fact that it doesn't take twice as long to roll my hair because the curler is falling apart makes it worth it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Eubanks

customer_reviews.title: Good substitute for hair salon
customer_reviews.text: Hair growing longer every day with the stay at home rules. These rollers are a great substitute for going to the hair salon. My "style" may be a bit questionable but at least I have some curls for my medium length straight fine hair.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Large and Soft
customer_reviews.text: I love these rollers, I can sleep in them and they last forever. My only negative is that they are just as expensive if you buy them in the store, so no price incentive to buy them at Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for heating tools
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to get away from heat because it was destroying my hair. These work great for straightening but still keep body in my hair. I put them in when my hair is about 80% dry and leave for a couple of hours. My kinky hair comes out smooth with very nice body. They don't seem to damage my hair and I don't miss heat tools at all. Better than velcro rollers because they don't pull on the hair
customer_reviews.author: Snowy16

customer_reviews.title: Eh, ok
customer_reviews.text: They dont stay in place. I have to remove the plastic pieces, and use the really large bobby pins to secure them.
customer_reviews.author: Mermaid

customer_reviews.title: Good for kids
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter (2) because she loves watching me curl my hair and wants me to curl hers. Don’t want to put heat on her hair so use these as an alternative. Fun to play around with for the both of it. Tried to use on my own personal hair and curled my hair so much i looked Like a founding father.
customer_reviews.author: Lissa Marie

customer_reviews.title: Old school bounce!
customer_reviews.text: Want those springy curls from your youth? When you really wanted a spiral perm but your mom wouldn’t let you?? These are great. Arrived intact. Good sizes. Might be hard for senior fingers to snap open and closed.
customer_reviews.author: dmb4500

customer_reviews.title: Had to learn all over again.
customer_reviews.text: It has been years since I even thought about using rollers . But without a hair dresser available I had to try something for my hair. I have natural curls and short hair and am not all that handy with styling tools. I can handle the front and sides but the back with all curls is difficult. So I tried these larger curlers, and even slept in them without problem. In the morning it was easy to take them out and style. Not bad !!
customer_reviews.author: Terry Pullin

customer_reviews.title: Best rollers EVER
customer_reviews.text: These are the best thing for your hair for a number of reasons. 1.If you want a vintage hairstyle or just curly hair. 2.If you have damaged color treated hair and dont want to use heat on it. 3.If you want a long lasting curl or was wave. 4. The easiest thing to sleep in ever. Squishy soft rollers with easy to snap in place clips, BEST invention since hairspray!♡
customer_reviews.author: Shannon S

customer_reviews.title: Skip it.
customer_reviews.text: First of all the zipper is stuck on both my curler packs and you have to cut them open which ruins the reusable packages. Some curlers look like Swiss cheese which means they won’t last long.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey Baltzer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and leave long lasting curls!
customer_reviews.text: I used them on dry hair overnight and they gave me incredible, large curls that actually lasted the entire day.... most curlers are either uncomfortable or too small and tight or leave a weird bump in your hair because of the clasp to hold them in place. I’m very impressed! My hair never holds an all day curl, until now!
customer_reviews.author: Abagail's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Needs two hands to operate.  Impossible.  Stupid design.
customer_reviews.text: The pink foam curlers in the 60s, 70s, 80s and 90s were perfect. These require a mommy to set a girl's hair. Must use two hands while at the same time keeping the hair wound properly on the curler. Not returnable. Three boxes of these useless curlers went out with the trash today. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Meg W.

customer_reviews.title: If you find it hard to sleep with rollers in your hair. Than try these sponge rollers.
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how easy it was to sleep with these rollers in my hair, I curl my hair often because of these rollers, and the curls come out beautifully shaped. I recommend these rollers to anyone to try.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah b.

customer_reviews.title: Bought for Vintage hairstyle
customer_reviews.text: I should have bought one without all the smaller ones. I have long hair and the yellow and blues and useless. I’ll keep it since I can use the pink ones and some green rollers. Curls come out perfectly though. Can’t wait to try vintage look!
customer_reviews.author: HyattsStuff

customer_reviews.title: Falling out
customer_reviews.text: They fall out of my hair. I put a hair net on to keep them in while I sleep but they unravel under the hair net. I also tried using them during day. Still fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Ava

customer_reviews.title: NO HEAT is involved ~ YAY~!
customer_reviews.text: My hair is not as long as it used to be because HEAT has destroyed it. From the roots to the ends. I used to have sponge sleeper rollers as a teen. Since I had thick hair with fewer split ends I used "old school" pink sponge ones and no blow dryers or curling irons. Conair big curl foam rollers are reviving my new growth and eventually my hair will look shiny and healthy again since I can already SEE the difference!
customer_reviews.author: KayBee

customer_reviews.title: Great for long hair.
customer_reviews.text: I have very long, abundant, fine, layered hair but I prefer to air dry. These work. I put them in when hair is almost dry and leave them in as long as possible (at least an hour) My hair will be somewhat curly but, more importantly, not frizzy. I haven't tried sleeping with them in other than strategically placing them where they would not be uncomfortable. I do recommend these. I ordered 2 sets which I needed for the volume of hair I have and used them all.
customer_reviews.author: Santa Claus

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE with GREAT curls
customer_reviews.text: Very good rollers and I love the wire inside because it allows me to bend them so they can stay in place overnight. These rollers are VERY comfortable and I get GREAT curls!
customer_reviews.author: Jamila Woods

customer_reviews.title: Blah
customer_reviews.text: I used these because I cannot curl my hair. Full disclosure I’ve never used any other types of curlers so i can’t compare it to any others. These were fairly easy to use. They are not comfortable to sleep on but I think that would be impossible. Only 2 of my 15 curls turned out and the largest size curl is still way tighter than advertised
customer_reviews.author: Claire Benningstone

customer_reviews.title: No hold.
customer_reviews.text: These just don’t stay at all. Doesn’t matter how much hair I put in it jut just flops around and comes out.
customer_reviews.author: Shera B.

customer_reviews.title: Old school hair curler solution
customer_reviews.text: I remember using these as a teen. But I've been pin-curling my hair for many years. My hair is too long on top for the style I want to wear it in so I puchased these to get a tighter curl. Works as well as they always did. Packaged well, received very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Radianze

customer_reviews.title: Good starter pack
customer_reviews.text: Comes in a convenient bag as shown. Exactly as I remember as a little kid. They collapse and compress as you sleep and expand back out as long as they are left uncompacted during the day. For best results: Use on damp hair over night with your head rapped with a silk/nylon scarf to keep everything together. After using for a while I realized I wanted more 1” rolls and got a suplimentry case.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Murphree

customer_reviews.title: Oldies and goodies
customer_reviews.text: These rollers work best on barely damp hair without much product in it. I use them on the ends of my braids or twist out sets on my type 2c/3a curls when I want a looser curl pattern. They are easy to sleep in and removes d they create bouncy curls. Tip: use a comb to get each section smooth first.
customer_reviews.author: RedheadwalkingTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: I love these......I am ordering again!
customer_reviews.text: Actually, I have ordered them twice, I can't wait til my hair grows a bit longer!!! Actually (if you don't want tight curly hair these are great, don't need your straightener!!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Dietz-Stein

customer_reviews.title: TOO HARD TO OPEN AND CLOSE
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, these curlers are MUCH too hard to open and close. I can't use them. During the Pandemic I cannot get to the hairdresser. These curlers are exactly what I needed in order to sleep on them but they are useless due to the closures.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Finnie

customer_reviews.title: I recommend that you try these on days you dont have ...
customer_reviews.text: Very big, and a little uncomfortable to sleep in. MyBecause they are so large, I was unable to set my hair without getting bend marks from the rollers in my hair. I recommend that you try these on days you dont have anywhere to go. It is important to understand your hair, and how to comb it out.
customer_reviews.author: Josh's wife

customer_reviews.title: Love these rollers
customer_reviews.text: I have tried all the top rated rollers on Amazon and these are my favorite. I am terrible with hair and everything has to be very simple or I just don't use it. I have lots of unused hair stuff. These rollers are easy to use, does not get trapped in my hair are comfortable enough to sleep in.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jones

customer_reviews.title: Was a gift for 3C hair
customer_reviews.text: I don’t use these on my 4C hair but I bought these as a gift for my friend that has 3C hair and she loves it! I don’t know what that material is but It doesn’t seem to stick to 3C hair but she also uses the little wrapping paper around the rollers. Then she raps it around her hair.
customer_reviews.author: Fatimeh Phipps

customer_reviews.title: They’re foam rollers.
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what foam rollers do. I have butt length hair and didn’t use all the rollers so it’s a good amount. I almost bought two because I was worried it wouldn’t be enough. Don’t know why anyone is leaving bad reviews. They’re inexpensive and as long as you use product (whatever types you like) for hold it should be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Little

customer_reviews.title: Love these rollers!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh these are fantastic! So easy to use and super comfy to sleep on! Ordered 2 sets they are so good! And your ends don't frizz out!
customer_reviews.author: Andria-Neicohl

customer_reviews.title: Curly curls
customer_reviews.text: If you want a head full of fun curls that will laslove these they give longer hair nice body n curl.t all day these will do it
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn

customer_reviews.title: Not for long or thick hair
customer_reviews.text: I bought these really hoping they would work. I’m lazy and thought this was the solution. I even bought 2 packs knowing that my hair is thick. I used 12 rollers so I didn’t make the chunks of hair too big. I left them in overnight, but my hair was almost as wet as when I put them in. On top of that, my hair got caught in the plastic mechanism in almost all of them. Ouch. That’s $12 I’ll never get back
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: These worked so well! Perfect for overnight curls. I would suggest hair to be dried a little before rolling. Great quality and great zipper plastic case they came in! I never thought these were used for drying power, so I was a little confused on that "Rate Features". They don't dry your hair.
customer_reviews.author: Bvera

customer_reviews.title: The assortment of sizes is awesome. Since I am growing out my hair
customer_reviews.text: These I use several times a week. The assortment of sizes is awesome. Since I am growing out my hair, these are perfect. The more curl you have the less anyone knows you haven't had your hair cut.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl clark

customer_reviews.title: and it's already curly but i like to do a tighter curl somedays
customer_reviews.text: So, i have short hair, and it's already curly but i like to do a tighter curl somedays, so i got these, so after spending around 2 hours putting them in my hair, i can tell you 2 things, the plastic is very bendable and cheap and i was constantly worried i was going to break it. some of the plastic on the rollers was already broken on the tips where you secure the roller and it was hard to secure them still waiting with these in my hair, so we'll see how it turns out
customer_reviews.author: Simmy

customer_reviews.title: It's a great size (diameter) for volume but length is too short ...
customer_reviews.text: The rolls are too short and did not hold my hair. It's a great size (diameter) for volume but length is too short for long hair.
customer_reviews.author: Annie B.

customer_reviews.title: Produce nice bouncy curls.
customer_reviews.text: I got these because I used them when I was a kid. I found them easy to use and I slept fine with them in. They produced bouncy curls that stayed in with a little hairspray. The curls stayed in for 2 days so I think I made a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Edge Obsessed

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: These Conair Big Curl foam rollers are useless. I would have given zero stars. They do not stay in your hair whatsoever and are very flimsy. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and left creases
customer_reviews.text: If super curly is what you want, these give you spiral curls. I didn't like they left intentions all over my head from the curler
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Love!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE these! I like to keep my styling no-heat as I have my hair long and want to avoid damage. I put these in when my hair is 80% dry and sleep on them. That’s right, I can actually sleep in them comfortably! These are the only rollers I have been able to use over night. In the morning, I simply take them out, finger through the curls (I do this while my head is upside down) and use hair spray. The result is amazing- just like using a 2 inch barrel with even more added volume. Would recommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: These are my first rollers and I really liked using them. They’re easy, they’re comfortable. I wish they had more of the biggest ones and less of the blue ones but the product is as shown.
customer_reviews.author: Cam B Brand

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I like them now as much as I liked them as a teenager. Easy to use and soft enough to sleep with them on. The price is great, the only unpleasantness, for me, is that they’re from China, but I can never find rollers, or combs, not made in China.
customer_reviews.author: maria amos

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: They worked pretty well. You do have to roll it the right way to not get a bend in your hair from the rod. I have extra long hair down to my butt, but it still curled. Took longer than usual to air dry but I’m sure it would be fine to blow dryer or use a drying cap on too.
customer_reviews.author: elora whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Good value!
customer_reviews.text: They are perfect! Came in wonderful condition and a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Xanthiar

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great long lasting curl
customer_reviews.text: Works well when hair is already dry just dampen the ends tool ‘em up, and use an oversized night cap. The big thing is not to roll when very wet, and don’t put too much hair in your curlers
customer_reviews.author: Viola

customer_reviews.title: fine hair that will never hold a perm
customer_reviews.text: I have very straight, fine hair that will never hold a perm. My hairdresser recommended these and they worked. I highly recommend you purchase the "end paper" so your hair does not kink, works like a charm once you figure out how to use them !
customer_reviews.author: Jeep4Trex

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for large curls
customer_reviews.text: They hold up as expected and are perfect size for very large curls in long hair. Wouldn't recommend them for shorter hair it just makes hair stick straight up.
customer_reviews.author: H. R.

customer_reviews.title: Best for Vintage Styles
customer_reviews.text: These are the best rollers for doing a vintage style wet set. My hair is a little longer than shoulder length, and I use only the yellow ones, but I like buying multiple packs so I have lots of them. I sleep in them every three nights, they are not painful and any discomfort is really easy to get used to. My style always lasts three days, I do not use setting lotion or anything beyond misting water.
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't even waste your time
customer_reviews.text: The syrofoam just clings to the hair and can tear when unrolling your hair. Though they will give nice curls, it just isn't worth getting my hair pull every time.
customer_reviews.author: Kali-billi

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but decent
customer_reviews.text: These are fine for what they are and why I bought them, which is for my 7 yr old to occasionally have sort of wavy hair when she wants to be "fancy". I certainly wouldn't advise them for the next Royal Wedding! They are hard to close, but served their purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Tattoo Mommie

customer_reviews.title: Best bouncy curls!!
customer_reviews.text: Set it dry before bed. Great curls in the morning. Used on 3 year old for wedding. Take rollers out. Do not brush! Take one of the curls from roller at a time, taking small strands out, and just twist around finger. Do the rest the same. Comes out gorgeous!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Foam just kind of mushes down when setting and hair skinks when you bend the rods to keep them in place. Puts a lot of static and frizz in the hair as well. I wish there was a happy medium between the harder rods which work but your hair gets caught in the plastic ends and these softer ones you can sleep on which doesn’t catch your hair.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Good luck getting the zipper open...
customer_reviews.text: The curlers are fine but I had to cut the carry case open because the zipper doesn't budge. I contacted Amazon, who sent a replacement set and that zipper doesn't budge either. I keep the curlers in a Ziploc.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn

product_meta.title: Conair Soft, Bouncy Curls Foam Rollers, 48 Pack
product_meta.description: Style Name:Soft Bouncy CurlsConair 48-pack of foam rollers with built in quick clips is easy to use on damp or dry hair. use with or without styling solution to produce tight, defined curls. soft, comfortable curlers are easy to sleep on. foam construction helps prevent breakage and splitting due to grabbing caused by other rollers. assorted sizes are color coded to produce curls of the same shape and size.
feature_bullets: FOAM ROLLERS: This set of 48 soft foam rollers deliver big body & curls overnight. Easy on hair & comfortable to sleep in, these rollers are perfect for wet or dry hair & all types & textures.
DO-IT-YOURSELF CURLS, WAVES, UPDOS & MORE: From hot rollers, straighteners, bun forms, & styling kits, Conair has everything you need to give yourself a salon-worthy hairstyle at home!

HIGH QUALITY HAIR ACCESSORIES: From classic scrunchies & no-damage hair elastics to glam bobby pins, curlers, rollers, hair wraps, clips, & brushes Conair has the accessories & styling tools you need.

INNOVATIVE HAIR CARE TOOLS: From blow dryers to auto-curlers, combo stylers, & specialty hair brushes—whatever your hair type or length, Conair has a styler that will let you create any look you feel like wearing!
CONAIR HAIR CARE: Since 1959, we have made innovative small appliances, hair styling tools, & more. Our hair care line includes high-quality hair dryers, brushes, styling tools, & hair accessories.
